Operational Protocol Rationale: Cargo vessels of this size and draught typically follow predefined curved approaches when transitioning between major shipping corridors in this region, such as moving from Route T toward the Slip inlet near Ballen-RÃ¸snÃ¦s. The observed stable speed, minimal heading variation, and gradual course adjustment reflect standard navigation practices for maintaining safe separation and predictable motion in congested or channel-constrained waters.
